question_text:
Question 54
Feed solution 
F
 is contacted with solvent 
B
 in an extraction process. Carrier liquid in the feed is 
A
 and 
the solute is 
C
. The ternary diagram depicting a single ideal stage extraction is given below. The dashed 
lines represent the tie-lines.
C
Y
F
W
M
U
A
B
The CORRECT option(s) is/are
(A) 
Y
 represents the composition of extract when minimum amount of solvent is used
(B) Maximum amount of solvent is required if the mixture composition is at 
W
(C) For the tie-lines shown, concentration of solute in the extract is higher than that in the raffinate
(D) 
U
 represents the raffinate composition if the mixture composition is at 
M
